1.brief: at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
to sing
Mosheh, the Israelite lawgiver
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a song; abstractly, singing
this (often used adverb)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to say (used with great latitude)
to say (used with great latitude)
to sing
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to mount up; hence, in general, to rise, (figuratively) be majestic
to mount up; hence, in general, to rise, (figuratively) be majestic
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
to ride (on an animal or in a vehicle); causatively, to place upon (for riding or generally), to despatch
to hurl; specifically, to shoot; figuratively, to delude or betray (as if causing to fall)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

2.brief: strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to rest (as at home); causatively (through the implied idea of beauty ), to celebrate (with praises)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)

3.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

4.brief: Paroh, a general title of Egyptian kings
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

a triple, i.e. (as a musical instrument) a triangle (or perhaps rather threestringed lute); also (as an indefinite, great quantity) a three-fold measure (perhaps a treble ephah); also (as an officer) a general of the third rank (upward, i.e. the highest)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

5.brief: an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
a deep place (of water or mud)
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so

6.brief: the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to expand, i.e. be great or (figuratively) magnificent
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to break in pieces; figuratively, harass

7.brief: to pull down or in pieces, break, destroy
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)

8.brief: wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to station, in various applications (literally or figuratively)
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to drip, or shed by trickling
to shrink, i.e. thicken (as unracked wine, curdled milk, clouded sky, frozen water)
an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to pour out (literally or figuratively), i.e. empty
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
